main_definition: A mentor is a wise and trusted advisor, teacher or guide who offers knowledge, support, and advice to someone less experienced.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An experienced individual guiding or teaching others in their personal or professional growth
meanings_and_examples.example: As a young entrepreneur, John sought the mentorship of an established business owner who provided valuable insights into the world of commerce.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person assigned to help another develop skills and knowledge in a particular field or area of interest
meanings_and_examples.example: In college, Emily was paired with a mentor from her industry to provide guidance on her career path after graduation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An elder or senior member of a community who shares wisdom and life lessons based on personal experience
meanings_and_examples.example: When faced with tough decisions, the village elders acted as mentors to younger generations, sharing their knowledge through storytelling.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A role model whose behavior or achievements serve as an example for others to follow
meanings_and_examples.example: Renowned scientist Marie Curie was a mentor to many aspiring female researchers during her time, demonstrating the possibilities of women in science.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who provides constructive feedback and helps an individual or group overcome obstacles
meanings_and_examples.example: During the project's challenging phase, the team leader served as a mentor to her colleagues by offering support and guidance when needed.
